thinking.disposable_income: Brighton Park is a working-class community with median household income around $43,000, significantly below Chicago's median. About 23% of families live below poverty level, indicating limited disposable income for many residents
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the lower income levels, residents have limited discretionary spending capacity. Higher sales taxes would have a significant impact on household budgets. Many families need to prioritize essential expenses over discretionary purchases
thinking.accessibility: The community has moderate transit access with CTA Orange Line and several bus routes. About 70% of residents commute by car, while 23% use public transit. Many residents work in manufacturing/service jobs requiring cross-city travel
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower transit fares ($0.75) to help transit-dependent residents and encourage transit use. 2. Moderate sales tax (1%) balances revenue needs with impact on low-income households. 3. Support modest driving fees ($0.50-$1.00) to fund transit while not overly burdening car-dependent workers. 4. Focus on proposals that reduce transit travel times to help workers access jobs. 5. Consider combined impact of fees/taxes on household budgets given limited disposable income
